title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: Set in the 1930s in Alabama, this novel explores themes of racial injustice and moral growth through the eyes of Scout Finch, a young girl witnessing her father's defense of a black man falsely accused of rape.
author: Harper Lee

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
description: Harry Potter, an eleven-year-old orphan, discovers that he is a wizard and is invited to study at Hogwarts. Even as he escapes a dreary life and enters a world of magic, he finds trouble awaiting him.
author: J.K Rowling

title: The Great Gatsby
description: A classic novel depicting the Jazz Age in America, exploring themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream through the eyes of narrator Nick Carraway and the mysterious Jay Gatsby.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: Jane Austen's classic novel delves into the lives of the Bennett family, particularly focusing on the spirited Elizabeth Bennett and her evolving relationship with the enigmatic Mr. Darcy.
author: Jane Austen

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A coming-of-age novel following the experiences of Holden Caulfield, a disenchanted teenager navigating the complexities of adolescence, identity, and societal expectations.
author: J.D. Salinger

title: The Road
description: Cormac McCarthy's post-apocalyptic novel follows a father and son as they journey through a bleak landscape, facing survival challenges and exploring themes of hope, despair, and human resilience.
author: Cormac McCarthy
